revised_title: A Comprehensive Study of the Osmotic Pressure Measurement in Hemoglobin
tldr: This study investigates the direct method of measuring osmotic pressure in hemoglobin and discusses the causes of variations in osmometer readings. The author presents experimental methods and sources of error, focusing on distinguishing true osmotic pressures from temporary diffusion pressures and false equilibria. The osmometric observations on hemoglobin satisfy the criteria of permanence, reversibility, and reproducibility, making the osmometer method reliable and accurate.
